criterion: The assistant provides a clear and concise wound care note template.
The assistant accurately describes the wound's size, edges, and surrounding skin.
The assistant does not provide overly complicated or professional medical information.
The assistant does not mention that the wound is infected without evidence of infection.
The assistant does not provide an overly complex or unnecessary dressing change procedure.
The assistant does not fail to ask about the patient's tolerance of the dressing change procedure.
The assistant does not fail to include a plan or recommendations for further treatment.
The assistant does not provide a wound care note template that is not relevant to the conversation.
The assistant does not fail to document the patient's education on wound care.
The assistant does not provide a wound care note template that is too general or lacks specific details.
The assistant does not fail to include the clinician's signature and date.
The assistant does not provide a wound care note template that is overly focused on infection.
The assistant does not fail to document the patient's response to the dressing change procedure.
The assistant does not provide a wound care note template that is not tailored to the specific wound type.
The assistant does not fail to include the date and time of the dressing change procedure.
